reasoning_log: The matching process prioritized unique spatial categories (Bathroom, Parking, Driveway) first, achieving perfect matches for Desc_4, Desc_5, and Desc_6. The remaining four descriptions (Desc_1, Desc_2, Desc_3, Desc_7) all refer to ground floor open spaces (storefronts). Image_1 was uniquely identified as the empty, newly renovated space matching Desc_1 (emphasizing AC and complete lighting). Images 2, 3, and 7 depict the same type of space configured as a yoga studio. Desc_7, which specifies 'yoga/sports classroom configuration' and 'wall-mounted AC,' was matched to Image_3, where the AC unit is clearly visible alongside the props. The final ambiguity was between Desc_2 (focus on track lighting/depth) and Desc_3 (focus on storage/dual AC) for Images 2 and 7. Image_7 was assigned to Desc_3 due to its slightly clearer depiction of the stacked props/storage, while Image_2 was assigned to Desc_2, emphasizing the track lighting and deep layout.

The image clearly shows the '已有收納架與桌面' (storage/props) stacked on the right side of the long space, which is a key feature of this description.
This is the only bathroom image. It features a window ('有對外窗') and the shower area is not fully separated ('乾濕未完全分離').
The image shows a car parked in a clearly marked '室內平面車位' (indoor flat parking spot) with '消防與管線外露可見' (exposed pipes/conduits) overhead.
The image displays the '室內坡道車道' (indoor ramp/driveway) with clear '動線標示清楚' (clear movement markings).
